name: Avoid Classes with High Cyclomatic Complexity (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all Classes with High Cyclomatic Complexity.
output:
This report lists all Classes with High Cyclomatic Complexity.

This QR provides the following information:
Class full name.
rationale:
The effort and time for diagnosis of deficiencies or causes of failures, or for
identification of parts to be modified is directly related to the number of execution paths, i.e. the
complexity of the control flow.
Analyzability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity.

Each modification must be correct for all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the
number of linearly independent paths and a lower boundary of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations.

Changeability declines with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity.
Complete testing requires
coverage of all execution paths. Cyclomatic Complexity computes the number of linearly independent paths
and a lower boundary of all execution paths ignoring multiple iterations.
Testability declines
with increasing Cyclomatic Complexity.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of Classes with High Cyclomatic Complexity.
